rows.LABOR ARCHITECTURE v3: Every role is a career booster. Every ask is reasonable. Every scope is achievable.
THE CORE PRINCIPLE
Nobody works here because they need the money.
Everyone works here because this is the best thing they could put on their resume.
The MC gets 200+ hours of hosted content for their reel.
The PM co-founders get co-founder credit on a funded company.
The admin gets venture studio operations experience from a YC-backed founder.
The experts get credited as domain validators on a published, funded project.
The product person gets the best portfolio piece of their career.
If we can't make that true for a role, the role is designed wrong.
THE ROLES
Role

MC
(Master of Ceremonies)
rows.col_2: Has conversations. 4-10 hrs per model with whoever is working on it. Asks the obvious questions. Records everything. Synthesizes into 60-90 sec daily updates.
rows.col_3: ALL models. The MC talks to everyone about everything. They are the connective tissue.
rows.col_4:
Part-time to full-time.
3-4 hrs/day recording.
1 hr/day daily update.
rows.col_5:
Equity (1-3%)
+ flat monthly ($1-2K if available)
+ content rights
rows.col_6: 200+ hrs of hosted professional content. Credit as face of a DAO launch. Unlike anything else in anyone's portfolio. Reel material for years.
rows.col_7: Acting students, journalism grads, podcast hosts building their audience, YouTubers who want a project. Someone who is GOOD ON CAMERA and GENUINELY CURIOUS.

rows.LABOR ARCHITECTURE v3:
Admin
(Operations Backbone)
rows.col_2: Scheduling. Filings. Candidate screening. Site updates (CMS). Tool setup. Calendar management. Entity paperwork. The glue.
rows.col_3: Cross-cutting. Supports PM co-founders, MC, and Nilo. Does not own any model.
rows.col_6: Venture studio operations experience. Reference from YC-backed founder. Inside view of how 7 businesses launch simultaneously. Resume line that opens doors.
rows.col_7: Upwork/OnlineJobs.ph. Smart, reliable, detail-oriented. Doesn't need to be on camera. Needs to be organized and responsive.

rows.LABOR ARCHITECTURE v3:
PM Co-Founder
(Cluster Lead)
rows.col_2: Owns one cluster of 4-8 models. Runs it like a production. Coordinates experts, drives milestones, manages quality. Makes decisions within M0 constraints.
rows.col_3:
ONE CLUSTER ONLY.
Not the whole company.
4-8 models with clear boundaries.
rows.col_4:
Part-time to full-time.
Depends on cluster complexity.
10-20 hrs/week.
rows.col_5:
Co-founder equity (3-8% per cluster)
+ name on docs
+ decision authority
rows.col_6: Co-founder of a funded company. Led a cluster from 0 to verified. Portfolio of operational documentation that demonstrates PM excellence. Co-founder title.
rows.col_7: MBA students, ops people at startups who want co-founder experience, former consultants, PMs at companies who are bored. People who are OVERQUALIFIED for their current role.

rows.LABOR ARCHITECTURE v3:
Expert Reviewer
(Domain Validator)
rows.col_2: Reviews AI-produced models in their domain. Reads through tabs. Grades quality. Marks what's wrong. Provides calibration. Name goes on the verified model.
rows.col_3:
ONE CLUSTER matching their expertise.
Reviews 4-8 models.
Multiple review sessions.
rows.col_4:
10-20 hours total per cluster.
Spread over 2-4 weeks.
Not a quick phone call.
rows.col_5:
Flat fee per model reviewed ($200-500)
+ equity (0.5-1%)
+ credit/attribution
rows.col_6: Published domain expert credit on a funded project. "I was the expert reviewer for the [formulation/marketing/finance] cluster of IonWave." Credibility artifact.
rows.col_7: LinkedIn outreach. Industry contacts. People who WRITE about their domain (bloggers, newsletter authors, consultants). They already think about this stuff.

rows.LABOR ARCHITECTURE v3:
Product Person
(Site Builder)
rows.col_2: Builds 2 sites: IonWave DAO launch page + infrastructure company page. Consumer-grade, cinematic, Remedy/Thakos quality.
rows.col_3:
2 sites in 2-3 weeks.
Defined deliverables.
Clear spec.
rows.col_5:
Equity (2-4%)
+ paid from raise if funded
+ portfolio rights
rows.col_6: THE best portfolio piece of their career. "I built the public-facing site for a DAO launch that got funded. Cinematic quality. Password-protected. Daily video updates." Career-defining case study.
rows.col_7: Bootcamp grads needing portfolio. Freelancers building practice. Designers who want to work on something that isn't another SaaS dashboard. The pitch: build this for equity, own the best case study you'll ever have.

rows.LABOR ARCHITECTURE v3:
CoS
(Chief of Staff / IonWave)
rows.col_2: Runs IonWave day-to-day once launch is funded. First operator hire. Brings capital access or capital.
rows.col_3:
IonWave only.
Executes the business that the Trade specifies.
rows.col_6: CEO/COO of a funded D2C brand built with the most documented launch process ever. If IonWave works, they're the operator who made it happen.
rows.col_7: Found by admin pipeline, vetted by PM co-founder, approved by Nilo. Later in the sequence â€” after proof exists.

rows.LABOR ARCHITECTURE v3: THE SEQUENCE
Week 0: Nilo + Claude produce M0 (Trade Thesis) and enough of S1-S3 to be legible
Week 1: Hire Admin (sources candidates for everything else)
Hire MC (starts recording conversations with Nilo on M0, S3)
Week 2: Hire PM Co-Founder #1 (takes first cluster)
Pitch Product Person (equity deal, spec ready, 2-week sprint starts)
Week 3: PM Co-Founder #1 activates first expert reviewer
MC records conversations with PM + experts
Product Person building sites
Admin screening for PM Co-Founder #2 and #3
Week 4+: Additional PM Co-Founders take additional clusters
Expert reviewers engaged per cluster
Site goes live (password-protected)
Content accumulates. Investors start watching.
Week 8+: CoS pipeline activated (IonWave-specific operator)
By now there's enough content and verified models to be compelling
